meanings.definition: A person who deceives or cheats others.
meanings.sent1: The stumer tricked his friends into giving him money.
meanings.sent2: She realized too late that he was a stumer and had lied about everything.
meanings.sent3: The stumer's tall tales always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His charming smile masked the stumer within.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the stumer who pretends to be your friend.

meanings.sent1: He tried to stumer his way out of trouble by making up excuses.
meanings.sent2: She felt guilty after deciding to stumer her classmates in the game.
meanings.sent3: The magician managed to stumer the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to stumer her into believing his lies.
meanings.sent5: The con artist knew how to stumer people with his smooth talk.

meanings.sent1: The stumer advertisement promised a free vacation but was a scam.
meanings.sent2: She knew better than to trust his stumer smile.
meanings.sent3: The stumer email claimed she had won a million dollars.
meanings.sent4: His stumer promises never came true.
meanings.sent5: The stumer appearance of the treasure chest hid its true contents.
